vmassol - (12:10): guys, is someone working on fixing the Add menu ?  
vmassol - (12:10): (it's too large making it quite awkward IMO)  
vmassol - (12:11): (it's overlaping on the logo)  
silviar left at 12:14 (Quit: Leaving.

vmassol - (13:32): we need to release 2.5M1 ASAP. Can we release now?  
vmassol - (13:32): (it was supposed to be released last week)  
sdumitriu - (13:32): Looking at Hudson now  
sdumitriu - (13:33): Hm, Hudson blocked  
sburjan` - (13:47): have we fixed the nasty bugs ?  
sdumitriu - (13:48): sburjan`: Which bugs?  
sdumitriu - (13:49): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/25Snapshots ?  
sburjan` - (13:49): about storage system  
sburjan` - (13:49): those aren't nasty :)  
sdumitriu - (13:49): cjdelisle: All working with attachments?  
sburjan` - (13:49): I mean.. not critical  
cjdelisle - (13:49): As far as I know.  
sburjan` - (13:49): attachments, lucene indexing, and the XEM bug I reported and it was already reported .. tmortagne knows about that  
sdumitriu - (13:50): sburjan`: Anyway, 25snapshots should be fixed, you should test after Hudson wakes up and makes the next build  
sdumitriu - (13:50): Except "Edit" menu doesn't display correctly when editing "Objects" in IE6 which can't be fixed  
sburjan` - (13:50): okay  
sburjan` - (13:50): I will test  
sburjan` - (13:50): I guess I';; recieve an e-mail when M1 is released  
sburjan` - (13:51): \*i'll  
vmassol - (13:51): jvdrean1: when can you release 2.5M1?  
vmassol - (13:52): (you're the RM right?)  
sburjan` - (13:52): tmortagne is afaik  
vmassol - (13:52): sburjan`: nope  
fmancinelli - (13:52): I think I fixed all the bugs that made REST and XMLRPC tests fail (two of them were due to the fact that now illegal language codes generate exception, and one concerns attachment code which generated duplication)  
jvdrean1 - (13:52): vmassol:  sdumitriu volunteered for the 2.5 series  
vmassol - (13:52): tmortagne was for 2.4 AFAIK  
vmassol - (13:53): sdumitriu: can you confirm you're handling it for 2.5 series?  
sburjan` - (13:53): fmancinelli: you're working on tests too ? :)  
sdumitriu - (13:53): vmassol: Confirmed  
vmassol - (13:53): sdumitriu: ok so, when are we releasing 2.5M1? later today?  
sdumitriu - (13:53): Yes  
vmassol - (13:53): ok cool  
sburjan` - (13:53): good  
sdumitriu - (13:53): After Hudson makes a build  
tmortagne - (13:54): sburjan`: not sure what you are talking about  
fmancinelli - (13:54): sburjan`: Yes. REST and XMLRPC. They should be ok now  
sburjan` left at 13:54 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 13:55  
sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 13:55  
sburjan\_ - (13:56): i knew that tmortagne  was the release manager. jvdrean1 did only the older releases  
sburjan\_ - (13:56): my mistake  
jvdrean1 left at 13:57 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds

sburjan` joined #xwiki at 14:01

sburjan left at 14:53 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol - (15:10): sburjan`: till now thomasM and JV were alternating releases  
vmassol - (15:10): now sergiu is playing too!  
sburjan` - (15:20): I see  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 15:57  
fmancinelli - (16:01): is it still possible to commit stuff?  
vmassol - (16:03): sdumitriu: any update on the release?  
sdumitriu - (16:03): fmancinelli: What stuff?  
sdumitriu - (16:04): I didn't start the release yet, so you can commit anything that won't break the build  
fmancinelli - (16:05): actually I am trying to fix a test  because locally it is fine but on hudson I see it failing :(  
vmassol - (16:09): cjdelisle/abusenius: I see you've used @since 2.5 in your crypto commits. However so far we've been using the milestone/RC name matching when the code was introduced. In this case it would be @since 2.5M1. Is there a reason we should change the rule?  
cjdelisle - (16:10): I wasn't planning to change the rule by subversion when I committed.  
abusenius - (16:10): +1  
vmassol - (16:10): abusenius: +1 to what? :)  
abusenius - (16:11): not chnging the rule  
vmassol - (16:11): ok  
vmassol - (16:11): cjdelisle: not sure I understand what you meant in your previous message  
cjdelisle - (16:12): I didn't mean to change the rule, I hadn't given it's value any thought, the 2.5 was just a mistake.  
vmassol - (16:13): ok cool  
vmassol - (16:13): was jsut wondering since I need to add a @since to some new code  
vmassol - (16:13): and I was planning to use @since 2.5M1  
vmassol - (16:13): I'll let you fix it then :)  
cjdelisle - (16:14): If it needs to be fixed for the release, can someone else do it? It's labor day and I'm trying to do as little as possible.  
cjdelisle - (16:14): solidarity :)  
vmassol - (16:14): there's no hurry  
vmassol - (16:14): it can be fixed after  
vmassol - (16:15): we should just not forget it I think  
abusenius - (16:15): I can fix it  
abusenius - (16:15): sed rulez  
abusenius - (16:18): should I put @since on the line before @version?  
vmassol - (16:19): I usually put it on the line after but we don't have a rule for that AFAIK  
abusenius - (16:19): ok, I'll leave it as is  
silviar left at 16:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (16:20): it's true we could order alphabetically  
abusenius - (16:22): fixed  
vmassol - (16:23): fast  
abusenius - (16:24): does somebody know what web/\*\*/templates/wysiwyginput.vm is for?  
abusenius - (16:26): it doesn't seem to be used, but was modified not so long time ago  
abusenius - (16:27): mostly by mflorea  
mflorea - (16:28): abusenius: it is used by the wysiwyg editor  
mflorea - (16:30): the URL of the rich text area iframe uses this template to render the input for the WYSIWYG editor  
sdumitriu - (16:49): fmancinelli: Are you looking into the core build failure?  
sdumitriu - (16:49): Lots of errors like this one: /home/hudsonagent/hudson\_root/workspace/xwiki-platform-core/trunk/xwiki-rest-model/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rest/model/jaxb/Pages.java:[45,7] duplicate class: org.xwiki.rest.model.jaxb.Pages  
sdumitriu - (16:49): Duplicate class  
fmancinelli - (16:57): sdumitriu: that directory should be removed from the build workspace. Vincent commited a modification that makes the pom.xml generate the classes directly in /target. It is just a leftover of the previous builds  
vmassol - (16:58): that's because the clean goal will not remove anything from the main src dir  
vmassol - (16:58): (unless the clean plugin is configured specifically)  
sdumitriu - (16:59): Who can do it? I don't have access to the hudson machine  
vmassol - (17:00): I think there's an option in the ui  
sdumitriu - (17:01): Yep, found it  
vmassol - (17:01): I've wiped the worksapce for the rest module  
fmancinelli - (17:02): I committed the latest fix. Locally it builds fine  
Enygma` left at 17:06 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
lpereira left at 17:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
evalica left at 17:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan` - (17:41): sdumitriu: ping  
sdumitriu - (17:41): Pong  
sburjan` - (17:42): I re-created the swap aprtition inside a logical partition  
sburjan` - (17:42): and now I can't swapon :))  
sdumitriu - (17:42): Did you mkswap?  
sburjan` - (17:42): swapon: /dev/sda5: swapon failed: Device or resource busy  
sburjan` - (17:43): created it from gparted, of swap type  
sburjan` - (17:43): df -h doesnt show it mounted  
sdumitriu - (17:44): Did you mkswap?  
sburjan` - (17:44): no  
sburjan` - (17:44): mount: unknown filesystem type 'swap'  
sburjan` - (17:44): well the partition is already created  
sburjan` - (17:45): sorinello@Phoenix:~$ sudo mkswap /dev/sda5  
sburjan` - (17:46): /dev/sda5: Device or resource busy  
sburjan` - (17:46): it's not even mounted  
sburjan` - (17:47): do I have to mount and after mkswap ?  
fmancinelli - (17:48): sburjan`: You cannot mount swapspace since there is no filesystem on it :)  
sburjan` - (17:48): but it's linux-swap as FS  
sburjan` - (17:49): it has a fs  
sdumitriu - (17:49): lsof /dev/sda5  
sburjan` - (17:49): nothing  
sburjan` - (17:49): I have an idea, brb  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 17:50  
sburjan` - (17:51): not working  
sburjan` - (17:52): when booting.. I get a warn that swap mount failed. Manual or skip mount  
fmancinelli - (17:55): sburjan`: when you created the swap partition did you assign the righ id? (82)  
sburjan` - (17:57): sorinello@Phoenix:~$ grep swap /etc/fstab  
sburjan` - (17:57): # swap was on /dev/sda4 during installation  
sburjan` - (17:57): UUID=d00ef2a0-6f1a-4784-9797-31ebb4d73a78 swap sw 0 0  
sburjan` - (17:57): how can I see it's ID ?  
sburjan` - (17:59): it seems that there is correlation between UUId and /dev/sda5  
sburjan` - (17:59): I used swapon from GParted  
sburjan` - (18:00): and it got mounted  
abusenius - (18:01): ls -l /dev/disk/by-id/\*  
vmassol left at 18:01 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius - (18:01): sorry, by-uuid  
fmancinelli - (18:02): sburjan`: I usually use fdisk /dev/sda, then p --- USE IT CAREFULLY!!! and if you never used it maybe you should wait for the next advice for finding the id :)  
sburjan` - (18:02): lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 10 2010-09-06 19:01 /dev/disk/by-uuid/d00ef2a0-6f1a-4784-9797-31ebb4d73a78 -> ../../sda5  
sburjan` - (18:03): I have created a logical parititon. and within that logical partition I re-created the swap space as linux-swap. Used GParted  
sburjan` - (18:03): dont understand what I did wrong  
florinciu left at 18:05 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sburjan` - (18:06): now swapon /dev/sda5 doesnt dive error, but doesnt mount it either  
fmancinelli - (18:07): sburjan`: it doesn't have to mount! Do a cat /proc/swaps to see if it's active  
sburjan` - (18:08): do I get another warning whwen booting  
sburjan` - (18:08): The disk drive for swap is not eady yet or not present  
sburjan` - (18:09): nothing  
sburjan` - (18:09): no device, noo partition  
abusenius - (18:11): what do you have in fstab?  
abusenius - (18:11): (about swap)  
abusenius - (18:11): and sda5  
sburjan` - (18:11): # swap was on /dev/sda4 during installation  
sburjan` - (18:11): UUID=d00ef2a0-6f1a-4784-9797-31ebb4d73a78 swap sw 0 0  
sburjan` - (18:12): and the UUID is the UUIT of the nwe swap pattition  
sburjan` - (18:12): it's n ot the old one  
sburjan` - (18:12): and why the hell isnt it working  
abusenius - (18:12): I have LABEL=swap none swap sw 0 0  
sburjan` - (18:13): I'm using ubuntu ...  
abusenius - (18:13): well s/LABEL/UUID/  
abusenius - (18:13): the point is the \*none\*  
sburjan` - (18:13): dunno what param is that  
abusenius - (18:13): where to mount  
abusenius - (18:14): (i.e. nowhere)  
sburjan` - (18:14): so should I put the none param in fstab and give it a try ?  
abusenius - (18:15): yes  
sburjan` - (18:15): and reboot ?  
abusenius - (18:15): try sudo swapon -a  
abusenius - (18:16): and  cat /proc/swaps  
sburjan` - (18:16): sorinello@Phoenix:~$ swapon -a  
sburjan` - (18:16): swapon: cannot find the device for UUID=d00ef2a0-6f1a-4784-9797-31ebb4d73a78  
sburjan` - (18:16): lol  
abusenius - (18:16): but it tries  
abusenius - (18:16): :)  
sburjan` - (18:16): yepp  
sburjan` - (18:16): it's a progress  
sburjan` - (18:16): now why the hell doesnt it like the UUID  
abusenius - (18:16): just say /dev/sda5 instead :)  
sburjan` - (18:17): swapon -a didnt returned nothing  
sburjan` - (18:17): sorinello@Phoenix:~$ cat /proc/swaps  
sburjan` - (18:17): Filename Type Size Used Priority  
sburjan` - (18:17): /dev/sda5 partition 4120632 0 -1  
sburjan` - (18:17): now it;s listed :)  
sburjan` - (18:18): fmancinelli: is this ok now ?  
sburjan` - (18:18): still not getting swap at df =h  
sburjan` - (18:18): df -h  
abusenius - (18:18): you shouldn't  
abusenius - (18:18): it is not mounted  
fmancinelli left at 18:19 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds  
lucaa left at 18:19 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sburjan` - (18:19): I rebooted to see if I still get the warning  
sburjan` - (18:19): nop.. no warning  
sburjan` - (18:20): but afaik.. i've seen stuff with /swap mountpoint on df -h .. maybe I was dreaming  
sburjan` - (18:20): but if it's not mounted, how is it used ?  
sdumitriu - (18:29): sburjan`: free  
sdumitriu - (18:29): What does it say?  
sburjan` - (18:30): Swap: 4120632 0 4120632  
sburjan` - (18:30): used is 0 :)  
abusenius - (18:30): it is used as memory extension, not as a block device  
sdumitriu - (18:31): Then you have 4G of swap active  
sburjan` - (18:31): so it's used only when the RAM gets full ?  
sdumitriu - (18:31): Yes  
sburjan` - (18:31): yes, I have 4G  
abusenius - (18:31): but you can as well use a file as swap, the fs where ths file is will need to be mounted then  
sburjan` - (18:31): I see  
sburjan` - (18:32): so swap doesnt necessarily to be a swap partition .. separate from / ext3-4 whatever  
sburjan` - (18:32): good to know :)
